ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about the UN and really changed my understanding of the organization.
Basic overview of UN mechanism

I did not take away much from this course in knowledge or skills. JF's insights into field work were valuable, and our trip to the UN was a highlight. However, the content of readings and class discussions were very low-level and uninteresting (even for those with only a basic knowledge of UN/humanitarian/dev topics)
A basic understanding of the operating bodies of the UN

I learnt about the structure of the UN as well as the UNs implementation of projects on the ground. It was insightful learning about the lesser-known, developmental aspects and work of the UN beyond just the UNSC and UNGA.
I learned more about every facet of the United Nations system then I could have hoped to have learned on my own. Moreover I learned a lot about how to write an effective policy memo.
An understanding of specific missions and initiatives lead by the UN in different countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength- covers a lot
Weakness- does not really go into the depth

The theory of the course is good but the execution of this course in its current form had a lot of issues. The plan was not clear enough nor was it taught in a particularly engaging manner. It was very fact focused and there was essentially no room for discussion.

I think the course could do with more discussion time rather than lecturing. There could be more discussion on the positives and negatives on the UNs projects on the ground too. Some parts felt like an advertisement for the UN.

I think this course does a great job of providing baseline knowledge of the United Nations system, however it does not do much to facilitate student engagement and could do more to have students use the knowledge they learn in lecture.
This class was more of a lecture than a seminar. Would like to have had more discussions.

The course was useful in providing insights to the inner workings of the UN. In the future, I hope the professor provides a clearer rubric for what she wants for each assignment. The assignment expectations were often unclear so students do not do well on them. Since the class is a seminar I wish there was also more discussion amongst the students. The class felt like a lecture most of the time.
The professor is an admirable person who can provide interesting behind the scenes stories. I do think the lecture itself could have been more interesting, but I'm sure it will improve over time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yeah, not a bad class, but it is not that great either. The grading is relatively easy, but there was nothing absolutely spectacular about the class.
Yes
Very low workload with equally low payoff. Class lectures/discussions were not engaging. As someone invested in the course topics, this was a big let down.

In its current form, I dont think so. The course needs to be anchored more in history that connects it to the present cases we study. The teaching was pretty all over the map and wasnt delivered in a cohesive manner.
I would if they are interested in world affairs and want to move beyond just politics and diplomacy.
I think if a student wants to better understand the United Nations or the international humanitarian system, this course would be an amazing experience for them.
Yes if interested in working within the UN
Highly recommend this course! Wonderful instructor!!

extras.title: GLBL 313 01 - The UN on the Ground
